page.title: 01Weston Lullingfield
page.content: Weston Lullingfield is a small village in a sparsely populated area of North Shropshire. It is fairly flat and was very marshy until it was drained, beginning in the 1880's. The fields are mainly grazing and arable where the land rises above the peat marshes. The village is in two settlements - Top Weston and Weston Wharf with Weston Common. The church lies midway between them. The only public buildings are the church, the school and the Village Hall. There are no shops now, although when the canal was in use there were more people and there was a Post Office, butcher's, grocer's and general stores(closed 1978). There are no parks or recreation grounds.
